author: Andrew Konopelny
title: Canada: Federal Clean Hydrogen Tax Credit Proposed To Bolster Investment In Clean Energy - MLT Aikins LLP
text:
The federal government recently provided additional information on the Clean Hydrogen Investment Tax Credit (the Clean Hydrogen ITC) that will refund up to 40% of investments in energy projects that produce clean hydrogen.
The Clean Hydrogen ITC was among five tax credits that Ottawa
announced in the March 2023 federal budget. The collective aim of
these credits is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and attract
investment in Canadian clean energy in order to compete with the
U.S. Inflation Reduction Act. Ottawa's
2023 Fall Economic Statement
released further details about the Clean Hydrogen ITC and stated it
will be formally launched after the spring 2024 budget, following
consultations in fall 2023.
MLT Aikins has previously discussed the opportunity for clean
hydrogen in Western Canada. In our past blogs, we have outlined how
[Alberta](/redirection.asp?article_id=1424792&company_id=27222&redirectaddress=https://www.mltaikins.com/energy/hydrogen-an-emerging-and-promising-industry-for-alberta-and-saskatchewan/) is the largest producer of hydrogen in
the country (and a world leader in hydrogen), while in
Saskatchewan, [Regina](/redirection.asp?article_id=1424792&company_id=27222&redirectaddress=https://www.mltaikins.com/energy/hydrogen-an-emerging-and-promising-industry-for-alberta-and-saskatchewan/) has the potential to become a hydrogen
hub. Meanwhile, world demand for clean energy continues to rise to
replace fossil fuels. By 2050, the global market for hydrogen is
projected to be worth over $2.5 trillion and will fulfill up to 24%
of energy demand.
Eligibility
[Hydrogen can be produced in a variety of ways](/redirection.asp?article_id=1424792&company_id=27222&redirectaddress=https://www.mltaikins.com/energy/hydrogen-an-emerging-and-promising-industry-for-alberta-and-saskatchewan/),
particularly from natural gas, nuclear or renewable energy, which
emits zero greenhouse gases. To qualify for the Clean Hydrogen ITC,
hydro, solar or wind power must be used to power electrolysis
‚Äì the process which produces hydrogen from such sources.
Power purchase agreements (PPAs) that detail the purchase of this
clean energy count towards calculating a project's carbon
intensity (CI).
Projects that employ renewable natural gas (RNG) to produce hydrogen may also be eligible for the Clean Hydrogen ITC, as long as greenhouse gas emissions are abated using carbon capture technology. RNG can be a lower CI alternative to natural gas which is extracted as a fossil fuel.
Assessment: Whether it centres on renewables or RNG, a project must undergo an initial CI assessment that is validated by a third-party engineering firm. Once Natural Resources Canada approves the expected CI of the project, the Clean Hydrogen ITC will be administered by the Canada Revenue Agency.
Timeline: The hydro, solar or wind power must be produced on or after March 28, 2023, and up to one year before the initial project CI assessment is submitted. Similarly, the RNG must have begun production no more than one year before the initial project CI assessment. Note that after 2034, the tax credit will be halved and in 2035 it will end.
Geography: These renewable forms of energy must be generated in the same province or territory as the clean hydrogen project and must be connected to the grid in such province or territory.
Tax credit calculation
A project computes and reports annually the effective CI of hydrogen it produces. After five years, the final weighted-average CI is calculated and compared to the expected CI of the project that Natural Resources Canada originally assessed at the start of the project. How much the verified CI after five years matches the expected CI determines the level of the final tax credit.
The
2023 Fall Economic Statement
supplied an example of a project that carries an initial CI
assessment of 0.6 kg of CO2e per kilogram of hydrogen
and is eligible for a 40% tax credit. After five years, if the
verified CI is less than 0.85 kg of CO2e per
kilogram of hydrogen, then the applicant receives 0% credit.
However, if the verified CI is between 0.85-2, then the credit is
15%. If the verified CI is 2-4, the credit is 25%. If the verified
CI is 4 or more, then the full 40% is granted. In other words, the
higher the verified CI, the greater the tax credit (plus applicable
interest). For example, at the 40% rate, a $40,000 tax credit is
awarded to a project with $100,000 in eligible costs.
Compliance
The compliance period would begin 120 days after starting commercial operations. However, projects would have the option of delaying by a full year. A second full year delay could also be available to allow project operators to make adjustments in order to deliver the expected CI of the hydrogen.
Eligible clean ammonia production equipment
The Clean Hydrogen ITC will also offer a 15% credit to support clean ammonia production. What is eligible is equipment used solely to convert clean hydrogen into ammonia, including that used for feed compression, conversion (i.e. reactors for the Haber‚ÄìBosch process), refrigeration and on-site storage of ammonia.
Property required to convert clean hydrogen into ammonia will also be eligible, provided that:
- the applicant producing the ammonia uses their own hydrogen feedstock;
- the feedstock comes from a clean hydrogen project that is eligible for the Clean Hydrogen ITC;
- the clean hydrogen project can fulfill the needs of the ammonia facility; and
- if the hydrogen and ammonia facilities are separate, it must be feasible to transport the hydrogen between those facilities.
If the hydrogen and ammonia are produced in the same facility, the cost of "dual-use" (shared) equipment (such as an air separation unit) will be allocated between hydrogen and ammonia equipment, based on the equipment's relative use between hydrogen and ammonia production.
Next steps
The Clean Hydrogen ITC aims to help reduce Canada's greenhouse gas emissions by 40-45% below 2005 levels by 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions by 2050. MLT Aikins continues to monitor this area for new development.
The content of this article is intended to provide a general guide to the subject matter. Specialist advice should be sought about your specific circumstances.

author: The Straits Times - Lifestyle
title: 'Waste of money and time': Gen Z, millennials are over traditional nightlife | Nestia
text: Businesses and young customers think Singapore's nightlife establishments close too early and cost too much to visit. PHOTO: KANPAI GROUP Teo Kai Xiang UPDATED Jan 31, 2025, 03:00 PM Thanks for sharing! SINGAPORE ‚Äì Drinkers of a previous era might recall nights along the bridges of Clarke Quay, where young adults would gather to play drinking games while downing cheap booze ‚Äì the first stop of their night before a visit to Singapore‚Äôs long-running nightclub, Zouk .Today, those bridges are quiet, and the nightlife landscape for Gen Zers and younger millennials is markedly different.For Mr Nicolas Tang, a 23-year-old student at Singapore Management University, coming of age during the Covid-19 pandemic meant an experience very different from that of his seniors. ‚ÄúI think Covid-19 killed the habit of seniors taking their freshmen and juniors out to bars and clubs,‚Äù he says.Affordability is also an issue. Mr Tang estimates having to spend more than $50 to get home if he stays out past midnight, after the last train has left.

author: Diego Tudares
title: El primer paciente de Neuralink juega a Mario Kart usando su mente
text:
El primer paciente de Neuralink juega a Mario Kart usando su mente
El avance tecnol√≥gico en el campo de la neurotecnolog√≠a alcanza un hito significativo con el primer paciente de Neuralink, Noland Arbaugh, quien puede jugar al Mario Kart utilizando
 solamente su pensamiento. Este logro representa un paso adelante en la utilizaci√≥n de interfaces cerebro-computadora para devolver la independencia a personas con discapacidades neurol√≥gicas.
Neuralink, la compa√±√≠a fundada por Elon Musk, ha desarrollado un chip cerebral llamado Telepathy, que utiliza m√°s de 1.000 electrodos diminutos para conectar la mente humana con dispositivos electr√≥nicos. Este chip ha demostrado ser capaz de codificar y transmitir se√±ales cerebrales, permitiendo a Arbaugh controlar los personajes del juego sin necesidad de tocar un controlador f√≠sico.
Para Arbaugh, quien perdi√≥ el movimiento corporal debido a un accidente, el chip cerebral ha significado una oportunidad de recuperar la autonom√≠a. Gracias a este dispositivo, puede realizar tareas cotidianas y disfrutar de
 actividades de entretenimiento, como jugar videojuegos, con tan solo el poder de su mente.
Neuralink tiene como objetivo utilizar su tecnolog√≠a no solo para el entretenimiento, sino tambi√©n para tratar enfermedades y trastornos neurol√≥gicos como el Parkinson, la epilepsia y la par√°lisis. Musk ha descrito el chip como una herramienta con m√∫ltiples aplicaciones m√©dicas y potencial en el campo del entretenimiento.
Un hombre paralizado de cuello hacia abajo jugando al Mario Kart gracias a un implante de Neuralink en su cerebro üß†‚Äî Apple en espa√±ol | IA, Tecnolog√≠a e Innovaci√≥n (@ghostcoreapple)
[pic.twitter.com/EUW6AxqJD0] [April 4, 2024]
Adem√°s de su uso en juegos, Neuralink est√° explorando aplicaciones m√©dicas m√°s amplias para su tecnolog√≠a. El chip cerebral, denominado Blindsight, ha demostrado la capacidad de devolver la visi√≥n a monos en pruebas preliminares, lo que podr√≠a representar una esperanza para personas con discapacidades visuales en el futuro.
La empresa asegura estar comprometida con la seguridad y el bienestar animal en sus investigaciones. Durante las pruebas con monos, los chips implantados no causaron da√±o ni muerte a los animales, lo que destaca el enfoque de la compa√±√≠a en la √©tica y el cuidado de los sujetos de prueba.
Fundada en 2016, Neuralink contin√∫a avanzando en la investigaci√≥n de interfaces cerebro-computadora para tratar enfermedades neurol√≥gicas. Con electrodos flexibles y un robot quir√∫rgico avanzado, la compa√±√≠a busca implantar estos dispositivos de manera segura en el cerebro humano, allanando el camino hacia un futuro donde la tecnolog√≠a pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas con discapacidades neurol√≥gicas. @mundiario

author: Daniel Duran
title: 43 casas afectadas tras fuertes lluvias en Zamora Chinchipe
text: Cuarenta y tres casas afectadas, deslizamiento de tierra y acumulaci√≥n de lodo dejaron las intensas precipitaciones ocurridas la noche de este jueves, 21 de marzo, a causa de la temporada invernal en la provincia de Zamora Chinchipe. Las llamadas de emergencia se coordinaron por el Servicio Integrado de Seguridad ECU911 con la Secretar√≠a Nacional de Gesti√≥n de Riesgos (SNGRE), el Cuerpo de Bomberos (CB), la Polic√≠a Nacional (PPN) y Servicios Municipales que acudieron a los diferentes sectores. [Hombre fue hallado incinerado junto a su motocicleta en Arenillas, cant√≥n de El Oro](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/seguridad/el-oro-hombre-hallado-muerto-arenillas-nota/) En el sector de Zurmi, cant√≥n Nangaritza, los bomberos asistieron y reportaron que 40 viviendas fueron afectadas por ingreso de lodo. Para la limpieza se coordin√≥ con maquinaria municipal, la cual retira tambi√©n escombros en las v√≠as. Publicidad Se detall√≥ que tres de estas casas registran afectaciones totalesy que afortunadamente no hubo personas heridas. En San Antonio del cant√≥n Yantzaza integrantes de tres familias reportaron afectaciones en sus casas debido al ingreso de lodo por los deslizamientos en la zona, por eso tambi√©n fue necesaria la activaci√≥n de las unidades de emergencia para la limpieza. [Presunto delincuente muri√≥ tras chocar con conductor que habr√≠a presenciado robo en gasolinera de Machala](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/seguridad/presunto-delincuente-murio-tras-chocar-con-conductor-que-habria-presenciado-robo-en-gasolinera-de-machala-nota/) Funcionarios de Gesti√≥n de Riesgos est√°n levantando informaci√≥n para las ayudas t√©cnicas necesarias. Publicidad La Polic√≠a Nacional report√≥ que en la v√≠a Paquisha-El Dorado-Tuntiak se produjeron varios deslizamientos de tierra y el desbordamiento de una quebrada, lo que oblig√≥ a las autoridades a cerrar el paso vehicular. Milena C√°rdenas, jefa local del ECU911 Loja y Zamora Chinchipe, indic√≥ que todos los eventos fueron monitoreados por el sistema de videovigilancia del ECU911 para su atenci√≥n. (I)

author: Steven Devadanam
title: Texas Children‚Äôs seeds MacGregor Park with $1.5M following Kinders' $27M green space gift - CultureMap Houston
text: a generous dose of love Texas Children‚Äôs seeds MacGregor Park with $1.5M following Kinders' $27M green space gift A historic Houston park has just been seeded with a major gift by a beloved local institution. [ Texas Children‚Äôs Hospital](https://www.texaschildrenspeople.org/) has donated $1.5 million to support the renovation of MacGregor Park, the hospital announced. Specifically, the Texas Children‚Äôs gift has been pledged to Houston Park Board, which oversees management, improvements, funding disbursement, and more for local parks and green spaces. This $1.5 million donation is made in honor of Ann Lents and Tom Bacon ‚Äî current and former board members of both Texas Children‚Äôs and Houston Parks Board ‚Äîand will support a five-year renovation plan slated to begin in January 2024, per press materials. The total cost of the five-year renovation project totals $54 million, with a major, $27 million boost coming from Houston benefactors Rich and Nancy Kinder. The Kinders ‚Äî as locals will recall ‚Äî set Memorial Park on its speedy improvement trajectory with their [game-changing, $70 million donation](https://houston.culturemap.com/news/city-life/04-25-18-massive-memorial-park-70-million-gift-means-a-whole-new-houston-greenspace/). Other funds come from monies raised by Houston Parks Board, which is responsible for $12.5 million; the City of Houston contributed ($5 million); the City of Houston‚Äôs Capital Improvement Plan ($1.5 million); Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone (TIRZ) 7 ($4 million) and a Community Project Funding Grant sponsored by Rep. Sheila Jackson Lee ($4 million). ‚ÄúWe remain committed to investing in projects that increase the quality of life for our community,‚Äù said Nancy Kinder, president and CEO of the Kinder Foundation, when the foundation announced the gift. ‚ÄúMacGregor Park is one of Houston‚Äôs most beloved parks, and we‚Äôre thrilled to contribute to a project that further develops and preserves this important green space in southeast Houston.‚Äù Macgregor Park will receive improvements, updates, and ‚Äúmuch-needed park maintenance.‚ÄùImage courtesy of M2L Associates As for those park improvements, plans include a new Texas Children‚Äôs play area, infrastructure enhancements, land and facility improvements, 20 new capital projects, and ‚Äúmuch-needed park maintenance,‚Äù press materials note. The new Texas Children‚Äôs play area is noteworthy as it creates a playground for Texas Children‚Äôs and other Med Center patients to enjoy green space and a break from treatments. Spanning some 65 acres along Brays Bayou, MacGregor Park has been a recreational favorite for local families since the 1920s. A familiar memorial statue of Martin Luther King, Jr. by sculptor Ken Washington serves as a park landmark and anchor. Its Homer Ford Tennis Center has been a decades-long go-to for Olympic and pro athletes; the basketball pavilion often showcases a who‚Äôs-who of part, current, and future NBA stars on its courts. The 1.25-mile hike and bike trail, sports field, swimming pool and wellness center serve as easy stops for active-minded locals and Med Center professionals. ‚ÄúFor almost 70 years, the mission of Texas Children‚Äôs has been to help ensure the health and well-being of the communities we serve,‚Äù Mark A. Wallace, president and CEO of Texas Children‚Äôs, noted in a statement. ‚ÄúSo when the opportunity to help support revitalizing our city‚Äôs historic park arose, we enthusiastically agreed.‚Äù Beth White, president and CEO of Houston Parks Board, echoed the board‚Äôs commitment to residents in a press statement. ‚ÄúFollowing a comprehensive and community-based master plan process, we heard what Houstonians want and need from MacGregor Park,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWith a visionary master plan and generous support from Texas Children's Hospital, the transformation of the beloved MacGregor Park will enhance and preserve this vibrant greenspace to ensure it continues to be a hub for community connection, where people can come together to celebrate and enjoy outdoor activities. This project reflects our commitment to park equity and improving the quality of life for Houstonians.‚ÄùDesign work for the park will begin in January, according to the Houston Parks Board, with construction estimated to start in 2025.

author: N√©stor P√©rez
title: Est√°n cerrados todos los senderos del Parque Nahuel Huapi por la gran acumulaci√≥n de nieve
text:
Est√°n cerrados todos los senderos del Parque Nahuel Huapi por la gran acumulaci√≥n de nieve
Por razones de seguridad tampoco se puede circular por una parte de los caminos del √°rea protegida. Adem√°s hay riesgo de avalanchas.
El Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi decidi√≥ mantener cerrados todos los senderos hasta nuevo aviso debido a la gran acumulaci√≥n de nieve en diversas zonas del √°rea protegida, producto de las intensas nevadas de las √∫ltimas semanas y
 en particular las de las √∫ltimos horas. La decisi√≥n se tom√≥ ¬´por estrictas razones de seguridad¬ª, informaron desde la intendencia del Parque Nahuel Huapi.
Adem√°s sigue vigente el informe emitido por el Centro de Informaci√≥n de Avalanchas Bariloche, que advierte sobre la gran acumulaci√≥n de nieve en las monta√±as y el incremento de peligro por avalanchas.
Se mantiene el cierre para el Circuito a Cascada los Alerces, Steffen (s√≥lo tr√°nsito para pobladores), ingreso a Seccional Guti√©rrez y Challhuaco.
Se habilita el camino a Tronador hasta el Ventisquero Negro, con portaci√≥n obligatoria de cadenas.
El camino a √ëirihuau solo se puede realizar por los pobladores, con portaci√≥n de cadena.
Personal de guardaparques, de infraestructura y log√≠stica y de Incendios, Comunicaciones y Emergencias se encuentra abocado al trabajo en las diversas √°reas realizando despeje de caminos y de √°rboles ca√≠dos.
